title: rustc panic with divide by zero

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'attempt to divide by zero', librustc_trans/abi.rs:430:26

Stripped down version of code to reproduce
```rust
mod a {
    pub trait A {}
}

mod b {
    pub struct Builder {}

    pub fn new() -> Builder {
        Builder {}
    }

    impl Builder {
        pub fn with_a(&mut self, _a: fn() -> ::a::A) {}
    }
}

pub use self::b::new;
```

## Meta `rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.26.0 (a77568041 2018-05-07)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a7756804103447ea4e68a71ccf071e7ad8f7a03e
commit-date: 2018-05-07
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.26.0
LLVM version: 6.0
```
stack backtrace:
